title: Patient-Reported Symptom Assessment and Early Chemotherapy Discontinuation in ... - medRxiv

summary.text: The study highlights that completing more frequent patient-reported symptom assessments after gastrointestinal cancer treatment initiation is associated with a lower risk of early discontinuation due to toxicity.
This association was consistent across different prognostic groups, suggesting its relevance in various stages and types of GI cancers.
The findings underscore the importance of regular symptom monitoring as a tool for improving adherence to chemotherapy regimens and potentially enhancing patient outcomes.
